Technique: WOVEN; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Mummy bandage
Description: Fragment of a mummy bandage with the representation, in black, of an offering scene. In the middle appears the god Osiris with the atef-crown, seated, with in his hands the crook and flail. Behind him a male person is shown, wearing an ankle-length kilt, a short wig and a headband which is tied in the neck, who is raising his arms in a gesture of adoration. In front of Osiris is a table laden with offerings and on the other side a woman, dressed in a long close-fitting tunic, is in adoration of the god of the dead.
